inn1.comm: wide outside off stump
run down to third man
edged inches past a diving second slip and Harmison no chance at third man. That would have gone down a third slips throat
again edged but wider, and Harmison didnt cove himself in glory as the ball evaded his dive
big appeal but Darrell Hair and Hawkeye both agree that the ball was sliding past off stump
Darrell Hair signals no shot to Jayasuriyas displeasure as the ball flies off his pads to the long-leg boundary
pushed neatly into the covers and they steal a quick single to Pietersen.
too much width and cracked square past Collingwood at backward point
sparred at ball wide of off stump
banged in and Tharanga not quite over it but the edge falls inches short of Marcus Trescothick at first slip
pushed off the back foot to the deep cover boundary. Plunkett struggling to match Harmisons accuracy
good response .... fast and with some bounce
pushed down the ground to mid off for a comfortable single
pitched up on his legs and flicked through midwicket
brilliant one-handed diving stop by Collingwood at backward point saves three runs
Jayasuriya wanted the single put Pietersen in quickly from point and Tharanga would have been yards short
pushed through the off and Pietersen makes a tumbling flick-back on the boundary to save one run
short and pulled square, albeit slightly uppishly, for a third-bounce boundary
missed an attempted pull and struck on the chest
Tharanga seems to be finding a fielder every time. Hes getting a bit bogged down
and again

finally Harmison gets what he deserves. Tharanga had been pinned down by good bowling and tight fielding and pushed onto the back foot, and Harmison pitched one slightly fuller which he edged low to Marcus Trescothick at first slip who took a fairly comfortable two-handed catch.
Jayasuriya loves being given width and Bresnan obliges, allowing the batsman to slash high over the covers for a one-bounce four
run down to third man
down the leg side
end of Powerplay No. 1 and the Oval crowd gasps in shock as Strauss calls for No. 2.
beautifully bowled, just beats the outside edge. He's got his radar switched on today
struck on thighpad - partial appeal
massive hoon outside off stump. That was a wild stroke and summed up the pressure Harmison is applying
end of a fine over
pushed defensively back down the pitch
pushed out to gully
eased into the covers, but straight to the fielder
hurried by this one, tight line and shorter in length
fired down the leg side to ease the pressure
and again, slightly lost it towards the end of a good over
leg-side again, but this time played back down the pitch to complete the over
scampered single as Collingwood dives and shies from point, always safe
how about that for a way to get off the mark, effortless flick off the pads sails all the way over the ropes
aggressive pull shot, brilliantly saved on the backward square-leg boundary by a diving Tim Bresnan
pushed back onto the stumps
gave himself room to slap the final ball of the over high and handsomely over the ring of cover fielders and away to the fence
newly patched up, but right back on the mark
unlucky call that, Jayasuriya made room and missed with a waft outside off
dropped at his feet and scampered single
big swing of the bat, clips body and away to fine leg
another quick single into the leg side. Sri Lanka are looking to pick up their tempo
and a good bouncer to finish the over
squared up and squirted for one to third man
slower ball, spotted early, down the pitch to meet it and smashed through the covers in typical fashion
thought about a single but sensibly changed his mind
that's the trademark shot, down the track again, smeared over backward point for a maximum
that salvo has forced a change in line, as Mahmood comes round the wicket
England dare not take their final Powerplay, as Sri Lanka are beginning to blaze at everything. Instead, here comes Paul Collingwood
pushed into covers
bobbled up off bat and pad, landed well short of bowler in follow-through
clipped backward of square for a single
more runs behind square as Sri Lanka work it expertly into the gaps
all very comfortable for the batsmen
and that single brings up the fifty partnership, from just 42 balls. It's an ominous platform that gives Andrew Strauss plenty to ponder
massive appeal from Geraint Jones behind the stumps, but Darrell Hair is unfooled
tighter line so far. Maybe delaying the Powerplay will pay off
worked into space on the off side
Sri Lanka content to deal in singles, and so too are England
a dot ball to finish a good first over
back after a break for drinks, and this one is flung down the leg side
pushed back down the track
confusion reigns, a good piece of fielding on the third man boundary, thrown back in, appeal for a run-out. But the batsman was well in
this one goes all the way as Collingwood strays leg-side again
this is all about as exciting as tonight's goalless encounter between England and Sweden
another near-miss down the leg side. Jones didn't bother appealing for this one
and more of the same. Dalrymple is doing a good job here for England
slower delivery, Jayawardene watched and waited and waited, and still mistimed it
pushed into space on the off side this time, but the end of a tight over.
no run on the off side. Once again, England are finding that a lack of pace is paying dividends. Messrs Dibbly, Dobbly and Wobbly are queuing up for a flight to the Caribbean
found the gap on the off side this time, largely because England's best fielder there is also bowling
slower delivery, Jayawardene watched and waited and waited, and still mistimed it
single down the ground, enlivened as bowler and non striker collide
another ball, another chip down the ground for a single. This over is becoming formulaic
yet another wide down the leg
Mahmood not much better second time round. Short outside off stump and Jayawardene leans back and hammers it through the covers
driven hard and a good diving semi-stop by Strauss at short extra-cover
decent slower ball, run down to third man and a no-ball as well
tip and run to mid off
Jayasuriya looks for a single dropped into the leg side by Strauss in quickly and batsman scrambles back
Jayasuriya brings up his 61st ODI fifty with a single dropped to leg
two steps down the pitch and slammed over extra cover for a one-bounce four. Englands young bowlers are being clobbered by a veteran
top-edged hook straight over Joness head for four
a result for England. Only the one run to third man
hooked just short of square leg
this one is hit slightly straighter and races across the outfield for another boundary.
single flicked to leg from wide outside off stump
running singles with ease. Were at that stage of the match the twilight zone that are often the middle overs of the ODI.
a bit more venom in that one and through Jayawardene before his had time to slash
up in the blockhole and dug out to leg for a single
a better over. Only four singles to restore some sense of normality. Sadly, Harmison alone appears able to stem the flow
slapped over the top to midwicket  sadly all the fielders are on the off
dismally bad bowling. With all the fielders on the off, Mahmood insists on peppering Jayasuriya down leg side and its a gift every time
better. Fast and outside off
into batsmans legs and scrambled single to short fine leg
Mahmood is so determined not to be hit to leg that hes bowling wides outside off  and Jayasuriya is still trying to hit it over midwicket!
and now he succeeds. Flicked ober midwicket for an oh-so-easy six. 17 off the over and Englands five-over Powerplay cost 49 runs.
attempted reverse sweep but he missed it, Jones missed it, and the ball trundled to the boundary. It should have been called a wide as well.
another wide. Unacceptable.
good tumbling stop at mid off limits it to one
cut and good stop by Collingwood at backward point
steps down to meet the ball and flicks it behind square to bring up his 34th ODI fifty. Both batsmen are on the attack and England are as limp as lettuces
attempted sweep, canons off pad and half-hearted attempt at a caught and bowled
Take that. Magnificent strike, gives himself room and launches the ball through extra cover.
Slightly shorter, cut square for four. Its like watching Zimbabwe in blue
Awful wide down the leg side. But at least it wasnt a boundary
driven to the sweeper
square drive and well stopped on the cover boundary
attempted sweep, missed
driven into covers
short and pulled into the leg side. Not quite timed
off-cutter, well directed, no chance of a run
cut firmly to point
quicker, and evades an attempted cut. Good over so far
leg-side, and nudged off the hips for one to finish
good grief, a wicket! Jayasuriya pushed off the back foot, Jayawardene looked for a single, sent back, slipped, Dalrymple fielded and whipped off the bails
massive appeal as Jayasuriya misses an attempted reverse sweep. Always going wide, but not the ideal moment for such a shot
Sri Lanka content to trade in singles
little more than a dab through the off side that time, but it whistled through the gap and all the way to the boundary
tighter line
one more through the off side

oooh ... nearly the breakthrough for England, as Jayasuriya chips into the leg side, but a diving KP can't quite get his fingers under the ball. And before the TV replays are called for, he quickly indicates the ball didn't carry. Super sportsmanship there
"Good start, KP" says Geraint Jones. And he's quite right
another dot, loopy guileful stuff
a nudge here
a nudge there
a nudge everywhere
and a dot to finish. Good stuff KP!
aggressive approach from Sangakkara, down the track and lofted impeccably straight for a one-bounce four
stuck in the nervous nineties, and being made to work for his hundred
injudicious sweep - he's not enjoying this tight line
nudge off the hips, and there it is. Jayasuriya hurtles through for his 20th ODI century, from 122 balls. He's had to work hard for the final stages, but he's set his side up for a good total
a firm cut through the off side, but picked up by the sweeper
attempted to turn into leg side, dropped the ball at his feet
Chipped to long-off
"Helloooo massive!" as someone, I forget who, once put it. Down the ground and clattered into the upper tiers of the pavilion
down the pitch and smearted through the covers. The end of an expensive final over for Dalrymple, with 13 coming from it to dent his figures
bounced just short of Plunkett in the deep
driven into covers
chipped over keepers head
a fine sweep. A relief for a weary-looking batsman
another attempted sweep, not so much on it this time, but another couple to the total
leading edge drops short of midwicket
low full toss steered to point
that one whistled through. A hint of an appeal from Jones, but that's as natural to him as breathing. Still, umpire Hair didn't signal a wide, so job done
more tidy stuff from KP
pushed into off side
elegantly driven for a single
too far down leg side
a deft flick, extremely fine. But four more welcome runs to Sri Lanka
and again. He's aiming for that leg-stump line, but over-doing it on occasions this over
flicked to the man on the 45
remarkable shot - a checked drive straight down the ground for four, sheer timing
yorker
and there it is. Shorter from Harmison, a typical bellicose smear into the off side, and Tim Bresnan at deep cover takes a superb tumbling catch to end a brilliant innings
so nearly two in two! Hoicked out to the leg-side, but Kabir Ali has strayed in from the boundary's edge and can only get a hand to it as he times his leap well. At least he saved the boundary
thick edge to third man, would have been swallowed by first slip
firmly pushed down the ground
shaping towards leg, bobbled away for a single
far too much width, carved away to vacant third man. Problems here for England
back-foot drive to off-side sweeper
made room, eased elegantly into gap through the covers. Twelve runs off the over and Sri Lanka are back on course for a massive total
tumbling stop by Collingwood at point
stepped across for the sweep, didn't quite nail it
so nearly a run-out! Dilshan chipped to mid-off and charged. Strauss had time to walk in and whip off the bails, but instead missed with his dive
full-length, whistles past off stump
slower ball, picked it early, but timed it too well for anything more than a single
and another breakthrough. Dilshan getting too ambitious, steps across his stumps for a tickled sweep to fine leg, but instead is bowled round his legs
blazing drive, doesn't quite pick the gap
half-flicked, half-clobbered to backward square-leg boundary
leg-side, and misses out
chip and charge to mid-off
picks the gap again, as Sri Lanka start to milk the bowling
slower ball, off-cutter, missed cut
down the leg side for yet another extra. That's 73 in two matches so far for England. Super stuff everyone
but a dot to finish
simply pinged off a length through the gap at cow corner. And that's Sangakkara's fifty, from just 40 balls. Mahmood, on the other hand, brought up his fifty ages ago
too much width - 17 wides in the innings now

... but Mahmood gets it right this time. Off-stump again, another big swish but too much hang-time. Pietersen at deep long-on takes a fine tumbling catch. England's cricket has been better the further they get from the centre of the pitch
and what'd'ya know? There goes another, as Maharoof is run out without facing. Collingwood at point had a single stump to aim at, and made no mistake
could have been an action replay, but Collingwood couldn't pick up this time
slower ball, pushed down the ground
and a horrible long-hop to finish. It's not been Mahmood's day today
It has been Harmy's on the other hand. Full length, flicked to midwicket where the skipper leads by example
pulled into space on leg side
swing and a miss
clubbed down the ground for one more run
swung into the leg-side
horrid wide, but well stopped by Jones
oh dear
and the wheels have come off for poor Mahmood - this one is half sweeped, half shovelled behind square for another four
swing and a miss ... and a dot ball! Maaarvellous
and it just gets better and better, as Vaas heaves ambitiously, and Jones snaffles the snick. That will soothe Mahmood's pain ... but not a lot
a helicopter swish at a bouncer, but only one run as it drops short of square leg
and a single to finish

inn2.comm: Vaas opens the bowling with the breeze blowing across the ground which will help him swing the ball
Vaas strays down the leg side and clipped to the fine-leg boundary
wide and getting wider
not much more than a push off the back foot through the covers and racing across the fast outfield
slashed on the up straight to backward point. The problem was that he was leaning back rather than over the ball and thats why it went in the air.
clipped off leg stump behind square and a superb one-handed diving pick-up by Mahroof on the rope
right on the button
and again, straight through Bell
well played off his legs to backward square leg
punched off the back foot to the cover boundary. All about timing rather than brute force
Bell shaped to hook but it was too far outside the off stump and a bit high. Called a wide to a few ironic cheers from the crowd who thought that a few earlier were every bit as ripe for the call
Fetch that! Wide from Vaas and bludgeoned behind square on the off
Vaas right on the button after the first ball
punched down to mid on for a quick single
uncontrolled pull in the air but short of long leg
that one was right through Strauss
driven straight back past Vaas, good use of feet
whipped off middle and leg
squeezed down to third man
cut just behind square and evading the despairing dive of Malinga charging round from third man
another push to mid on for a comfortable single
this is all a bit low key from England.  Fireworks are needed but the fuse appears to be damp.
Oops. Strauss tries to hit over the top but it was a tad too short and he only succeeded in skying the ball to mid off. Enter Pietersen. England expects
pushed down the ground for another single. England need a bit more than that though ...
now that's more like it, a blazing cover-drive from KP. Split the field like an axe. He's rather fond of this ground, after that 158 last summer .... I wonder ...
dabbed down to third man
blazing stroke! That's KP at his most belligerent, short, on the back foot, driven venomously with a uniquely tangled mixture of a shot
attempted something similar, but this time under-edged into the crease
he's not on fire this over, but Maharoof is rising to KP's challenge nonetheless
that's unfortunate - a good over spoiled
right on the money again from The Slinger. How on earth does he get so accurate with an action like that? Essex's bowling guru, Ian Pont, would do his nut about it. And that's a fact.
more of the same, similar result
stands tall and delivers, a front-footed clout through point. Extraordinary shot!
but tighter again this time
a real game of cat and mouse developing between these two. For the good of the game, KP has to go big here.
attempted carve through point, but intercepted. Good over
width this time, and walloped through point. Shot Belly!
and good rotation of the strike as well. Super stuff
extra bounce, lucky not to spoon it up to cover. KP is looking to use his height at every opportunity
KP's biding his time here, and rightly so. England have a massive chase ahead of them, and this is shaping up as the pivotal partnership
single to keep the strike
worked into the leg side
clipped down to third man
bosh! Vast six over cow corner! This is more like it! Batman and Robin, in the Peter May enclosure, enjoyed that one
down the leg side
Somebody's strangled a cat out in the middle of the pitch. Oh no, it's actually Perera's lbw appeal. KP took three steps down the pitch and the ball was going high. But pretty close otherwise
pulled to deep square-leg, just dropped short of the fielder! Lucky escape
steady stuff from Bell
more steadiness
steadily squeezed to point for no run
and a single to third man. Steady on!
and KP joins the steadi-fest
and a spanking shot to finish. In truth he scuffed it a touch, but it cleared the man at mid-off and went all the way for four. And that much, my friends, is a fact
a bit of a fumble at long-off
nothing fancy as yet from Ian Ronald Bell. Unlike his middle name
cor! That travelled! Right to the pitch of the ball, full swing of the bat, and maximum!
these two are doing enough at the moment for England. But Murali's lying in wait when the Powerplays are up ...
tucked off his hip for two more

big shout for lbw, but that's not the worry for England. That delivery cracked Pietersen an agonising blow on the side of the knee, and he went down like the proverbial, albeit with an heroic dive back into his crease. Out comes the physio. Impartiality aside, let's hope his mobility isn't impaired, cos without him this chase is more doomed than it is already
no ill-effects so far
controlled edge to third man
tucked away for a single
missed out with a carve through the off side
keeper now standing up, which gives the batsmen something extra to think about
swing and a miss - KP anchored to the crease
tight stuff so far this over
... but there's the width, and KP is onto it in a flash. Blazing four through the covers!
and four more! Problems now for Perera, as KP stands and delivers with a ruthless hoick through midwicket
clipped leg-side to finish. A good over from England

I think it's fair to say that KP has got the measure of the pitch now. He met this one at the top of its bounce and bludgeoned straight through the spot where Ian Bell had been standing at the non-striker's end.

oh dear, that's the breakthrough. A muffed pull spirals into no-man's land on the leg-side, and Muralitharan runs round to complete a fine catch over his shoulder. A pity, because he was starting to warm to his task out there
Now the fun starts as Muralitharan v Pietersen underway
swept with real power through the man on the square-leg boundary
flicked to the leg side for a single
Maharoof back at the Vauxhall End. Pietersen still limping from the blow on the knee
easy single to third man. Meanwhile the TV commentators guffawing at slow-motion shots of Pietersen in agony ...
superb punch off the back foot but sadly he missed it
Pietersen brings up his fifty with a slash over point for four. The crowd springs to life
no run but some Sunday afternoon fielding
Murali has Collingwood tied down
a heave to leg gets runs and gives Collingwood some relief
short, smacked to square leg who misfields and the batsmen engage in some stop-start calling. Good cricket all round.
the problem here for Collingwood is that he hasnt time to play himself in and he is struggling to get the ball away.
drop and run gives KP the strike
flashing drive quite brilliantly stopped by the sub diving full length at short extra cover. KP gets the strike back
ambled single to long on. Pietersen struggling to move between the wickets at anything above a slow trot
turned behind square. Sri Lanka seem happy to give singles
easy one to square leg
if these two can get settled then the give-a-single approach may be a mistake  a big if though.
KP lofts to deep backward square where Perera is caught in no mans land and the ball goes for four. Bowler unimpressed, fielder embarrassed but lucky not have been nutted as he completely lost it
containment policy goes to pot as Collingwood pulls a short one over midwicket for a one-bounce four.  The asking rate goes down a tad!
Pietersen pushed to the vacant point position for an easy one
same again. Murali not quite as easy to smack so singles the order of the day
back to square one after another tight one from Murali
he starts with a wide and then resets his field
Russel Arnold bottles it and checks when running in to a lofted drive by Pietersen at long-on.  Could be a key moment. Jayasuriya less than impressed to put it mildly.
ironic cheers as the hapless Arnold fields the ball and the batsmen amble a single
smacked to the cover boundary but still just the single
whipped to square leg, all wrists and bottom hand, for a single
a single to finish another good over for Sri Lanka.
poor old Russel Arnold gets more ironic cheers for stopping the ball cleanly
chipped into the vacant wide mid-on area
sloppy misfield at deep square leg allows England an extra run
this is a crucial phase of the game. They say a team should score the same in their last 20 overs as they managed in their first 30 ... which makes England victors with something to spare ...
clipped away, nothing fussy in this over so far. England have seen what this man can do to an innings already this summer
comprehensively beaten, and he acknowledges it as well
a single to finish, just two runs off a typically tight over
trading singles for the moment. Biding their time

and that could be a game-breaker. Massive breakthrough for Sri Lanka, and it's not the spinner that everyone assumed would make the difference. Big rip out of the leg-side rough, Pietersen aimed a smear through midwicket, well beaten
watchfully pushed back down the pitch, and after that last delivery, with good reason
clipped into the leg-side. Collingwood needs to come to the party now
good running between the wickets gets Dalrymple off the mark with two to third man
he's got form at least, with a composed 67 at Lord's on Saturday
another squirt to third man
stood tall and pushed into covers
sliced drive to backward point
twinkle-toed footwork. Or maybe he was just beaten in flight. Either way, one through square leg is the result
tight on leg stump again. Difficult to work away
excellent rhythm from the Man-of-the-Match elect
more of the same. Nothing Dalrymple can do but not give his wicket away
worked away this time, but only for one, as the run-rate surges again
and Collingwood returns the complement. Excellent over
Collingwood is the key now. But since KP's demise, the momentum has vanished
firm push to long-off. But there's no way through the field at present
another single ...
width this time, but a swing-and-a-miss as Colly's eyes light up
more composed drive this time, fielded on the cover boundary
tighter line, forced to defend
might have been wide if he left it, but instead toe-ended into the covers
worked away this time, but someone's going to have to play the big shots soon
one more, but impatience starting to creep in as they contemplate a suicidal second
no boundary for ten overs now. And Jayasuriya has been central to that
that's more like it from Collingwood. Firmly driven into the gap square of the wicket. That'll help the run-rate
oh dear, that's a horrible drop in the deep from Arnold. Dalrymple hoisted one down to long off, and it seemed to go into the hands and straight out again. Costly? Maybe ...
back to trading singles. Still, less than nine an over needed, so one boundary an over will suffice. Finding that boundary, however ...
These two are forging a useful partnership. There's nothing untoward in the pitch at all
one to finish, and that's a decent over for England
another single. At least they are still coming
Dalrymple returns the compliment
nicely chipped into space on the off side. Back for the second to move to within one of his half-century
and there it is. Well played. Judged the pace of the pitch, and has given England a better-than-usual chance of pulling off a tough chase
one to finish. England are keeping wickets in hand and, as we've seen from Collingwood in the past, he has another gear to move into as and when
but Murali still has four overs, and here he comes again. Dalrymple works this one nicely for a single
six an over from Murali's last spell would do nicely for England. Well, it would give them a chance at least
worked into the off side. Quick between the wickets
reverse-sweep, but didn't find the gap
half an appeal to finish, but Darrell Hair is unmoved. Outside the line probably
leading edge flies safe and into space on the off side
well bowled but badly fielded, as Jayasuriya lets a single go through his hands down to long off
Dalrymple's forced to scamper as they look for two, but he's safely home as the shy comes in from square leg

and that might be that, as Colly misses and loses his middle stump. Quicker and flatter from Jayasuriya, and buzzed through his aggressive stroke. Big breakthrough from an under-rated bowler, and Sri Lanka are all but 2-0 up
worked into leg side
driven firmly into covers.
and that takes the run-rate up past ten an over. Time for fireworks
... or not
... maybe he's playing himself in
problems for England. But we knew that already
it's looking like a lost cause now, but this is turning into another composed performance from England's new boy
useful two ... actually, who am I kidding? This game is as dead as the remnants of last week's victoria sponge that I just found under my Wisden Almanack
four off the over. Splendid stuff from Sanath
ooh! That was unexpected, and the crowd is rousing momentarily from its torpor

only momentarily mind. Next ball, Jones aims to sweep, the ball loops off his pad, conceivably brushes the glove, and is routinely snatched by Sangakkara behind the stumps. Jones, one senses, is not best pleased with that decision
he had a tough ask in the Twenty20, now here's an even more hopeless cause for young Bresnan to rescue
bosh! This boy can play! Smeared mightily over midwicket for a maximum! A bit of support and perhaps ... actually, nah ...
Lofted over the covers, now there's a bit of a tussle brewing again
gives himself room, and four more. England have relocated their ticker, even if this rally seems to be coming rather too late
one more, just to keep things ticking over
and another

got im! And there's that quicker ball again. Up near 60mph, which is brisk for a spinner, and Dalrymple is stranded a mile out of his crease. Oh well, it was fun while it lasted, and another good performance from England's new boy
two men at the crease who enjoy a swing of the bat
they'll need to ...
arguably the loudest cheer of the day as this one sneaks under the fielder and away to the boundary
in fact, it was the loudest cheer of the day, confirms Will Luke, our man at The Oval
but stony silence all around the ground now, as Mahmood scampers for a make-or-break single, and is broken by Sangakkara's shy at the non-striker's end
ho hum, another single.
direct hit from Sri Lanka's best fielder, and another nail in England's coffin.
a mighty smear, straight down the ground! Lovely stuff, youngster. Well done everyone, etc
that six briefly took the asking-rate back below two a ball. But that dot ... you get the rest
but that is the two a ball needed ... not over yet ... ahem ... splutter ...

and that is comprehensively that. A suitably shambolic denouement, as Harmison swung, missed, started, stopped, went hell for leather anyway, keeper lobbed the ball, Murali whipped the bails, and you can guess the rest.
